definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
